Joey Jo Jo Jr. Shabadoo - February 28, 2012 - Version 0.40.7
Effortless
If you have a custom ROM like Oxygen or CyanogenMod, you can edit these brightness levels anyway - but it's so fiddly to guess what numbers are needed that many, myself included, don't bother and end up with suboptimal defaults. By contrast, the beauty of this application is easily pulling up the 'dash' over whatever you're doing (from the notifications bar) and it remembering your choice for that light level - after several weeks of this, you get something suited to you and your phone. "Subzero" (lower than stock) dim settings are a must for night-time, it's worth it for these alone. I was hoping colour temperature would auto-dim like F.lux after dark - unfortunately it's currently manual. The effect is also not quite the same (blacks go red rather than staying black). I reached out to the dev and got this answer within five minutes - support like this is enough for five stars! "Auto night mode is already in the works. I use F.lux on my PC, so the idea of having a similar feature on Android has always been on the agenda. The main problem is that I currently have to use a red overlay [unless I write my own OpenGL drivers, or use Chainfire3D]. I'll have to see what we can do!"
